content: overcome by something healing (Heilsames) on a walk: not just the capaciousness (Geräumige) of the expanse (Weite) but the expanse itself > carried to what is objectless w/out dissolving, expanse delivers our essence to the open (Offene), gathers it into simplicity: as if the expanse’s abiding (Verweilen) were a pure arrival (reine Ankunft)—we are the entranceway (Einlass) [cf. p. 147]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: overcome by something healing (Heilsames) on a walk: not just the capaciousness (Geräumige) of the expanse (Weite) but the expanse itself > carried to what is objectless w/out dissolving, expanse delivers our essence to the open (Offene), gathers it into simplicity: as if the expanse’s abiding (Verweilen) were a pure arrival (reine Ankunft)—we are the entranceway (Einlass) [cf. p. 147]

content: healing expanse not the forest, forest let into what heals
linkedContent: healing expanse not the forest, forest let into what heals

content: did the younger man experience what is healing (das Heilsame) in contrast (Gegensatz) to the unwholesomeness (heillosen) of Camp? a fleeting self-deception? > no, because it has abided since morning in such a releasing (lösend), signifying (deutend), gathering manner…
linkedContent: did the younger man experience what is healing (das Heilsame) in contrast (Gegensatz) to the unwholesomeness (heillosen) of Camp? a fleeting self-deception? > no, because it has abided since morning in such a releasing (lösend), signifying (deutend), gathering manner…

content: too deplorable [?] to waste a complaint (Klage) on blinded leading-astray of our own people, the devastation of our native soul > the men had decided to remain silent about this devastation (Verwüstung), which existed for a long time, & can’t be reduced to a visible enumeration—not the result of instances of human death

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

linkedContent: too deplorable [?] to waste a complaint (Klage) on blinded leading-astray of our own people, the devastation of our native soul > the men had decided to remain silent about this devastation (Verwüstung), which existed for a long time, & can’t be reduced to a visible enumeration—not the result of instances of human death

content: because devastation is deeper, comes from farther away, our thoughts return to it again and again > the devastation of earth, the annihilation (Vernichtung) of human essence: evil itself (das Böse selbst) > evil not as the morally bad, the reprehensible, but as malice (Bösartige)
linkedContent: because devastation is deeper, comes from farther away, our thoughts return to it again and again > the devastation of earth, the annihilation (Vernichtung) of human essence: evil itself (das Böse selbst) > evil not as the morally bad, the reprehensible, but as malice (Bösartige)

content: referring to evil I see better how we can encounter devastation, that we cannot encounter devastation > must think devastation more rigorously > since devastation is not moral badness (Schlechtigkeit), moral indignation (moralische Entrüstung), even if it makes general public (Weltöffentlichkeit) its mouthpiece, can’t do anything against devastation > moral superiority (Überlegenheit) in no position to grasp, much less abolish (aufzuheben)/mitigate evil

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

linkedContent: referring to evil I see better how we can encounter devastation, that we cannot encounter devastation > must think devastation more rigorously > since devastation is not moral badness (Schlechtigkeit), moral indignation (moralische Entrüstung), even if it makes general public (Weltöffentlichkeit) its mouthpiece, can’t do anything against devastation > moral superiority (Überlegenheit) in no position to grasp, much less abolish (aufzuheben)/mitigate evil

content: malice is insurgency (Aufrührerische), das im Grimmigen beruht (rests in furiousness) > essence of evil is rage (Ingrimm) of insurgency (furiousness conceals this rage, in a certain sense) > perhaps the will itself is what is evil > yes, perhaps
linkedContent: malice is insurgency (Aufrührerische), das im Grimmigen beruht (rests in furiousness) > essence of evil is rage (Ingrimm) of insurgency (furiousness conceals this rage, in a certain sense) > perhaps the will itself is what is evil > yes, perhaps

content: Nietzsche interpreted morality, the Platonic-Christian ethical doctrine, & its later secularized forms (rational Ethics of Enlightenment/socialism), as appearances (Erscheinungen) of will to power > Nietzsche didn’t realize that a will to power “beyond good & evil,” as realm of pure will to power, remains only counter-world (Gegenwelt) to Platonism > Nietzsche’s doctrine of “discipline and breeding (Zucht und Züchtung)” is extreme affirmation of morality > if will is evil, will to power is least of all beyond evil

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

content: devastation concerns our own essence in a way we’re just beginning to presage (ahnen) [proximity to presupposition]
linkedContent: devastation concerns our own essence in a way we’re just beginning to presage (ahnen) [proximity to presupposition]

content: could be that morality, w/ its visions of world order, is a monstrous offspring (Ausgeburt) of evil, & the much-appealed-to (vielberufene) Weltöffentlichkeit (word’s general public) remains in essence a construct (Gebild) and product (Erzeugnis) of devastation

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

linkedContent: could be that morality, w/ its visions of world order, is a monstrous offspring (Ausgeburt) of evil, & the much-appealed-to (vielberufene) Weltöffentlichkeit (word’s general public) remains in essence a construct (Gebild) and product (Erzeugnis) of devastation

content: we are not yet standing truly free in the midst of the essence of devastation > we must be granted (vergönnt) the privilege (Gunst) of this thinking > devastation is a far-reaching event (vorausgreifendes Ereignis), one that suffocates possibility for something essential to arise/bloom [Bataille’s restricted economy]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

linkedContent: we are not yet standing truly free in the midst of the essence of devastation > we must be granted (vergönnt) the privilege (Gunst) of this thinking > devastation is a far-reaching event (vorausgreifendes Ereignis), one that suffocates possibility for something essential to arise/bloom [Bataille’s restricted economy]

content: standpoint of superiority (überlegeneren Standort) an attitude that no longer pays heed (kehrt) to devastation: a will of aversion (Widerwille) forces us to morally evaluate devastation
linkedContent: standpoint of superiority (überlegeneren Standort) an attitude that no longer pays heed (kehrt) to devastation: a will of aversion (Widerwille) forces us to morally evaluate devastation

content: that which suffocates (Erstickende) does so hiding behind something insidious (Verfänglichen), that which announces (kundgibt) itself as one of man’s highest ideals: progress (Fortschritt), unrestrained achievement in all areas of creating, equal employment opportunities, & (the highest rationale) uniform welfare for all workers > what is really devastating is the way man obsesses with these goals (Ziele), devotes everything to their realization, driving on devastation (reinforcing its own consequences) [almost Freudian death drive logic]
linkedContent: that which suffocates (Erstickende) does so hiding behind something insidious (Verfänglichen), that which announces (kundgibt) itself as one of man’s highest ideals: progress (Fortschritt), unrestrained achievement in all areas of creating, equal employment opportunities, & (the highest rationale) uniform welfare for all workers > what is really devastating is the way man obsesses with these goals (Ziele), devotes everything to their realization, driving on devastation (reinforcing its own consequences) [almost Freudian death drive logic]

content: devastation (Verwüstung): everything (human, world, earth) will transform into desert (Wüste) > desert is already there, doesn’t accumulate little by little, is there in an instant (Nu), in order to draw everything to it, to desert-ify (ver-wüsten)
linkedContent: devastation (Verwüstung): everything (human, world, earth) will transform into desert (Wüste) > desert is already there, doesn’t accumulate little by little, is there in an instant (Nu), in order to draw everything to it, to desert-ify (ver-wüsten)

content: World War only consequence of devastation [ontological history]
linkedContent: World War only consequence of devastation [ontological history]

content: human individuals spurring on the devastation are subordinate to it, angry functionaries of their own mediocrity (Mittelmässigkeit), stand lower than wretched (Dürftige) who stand w/in their limits
linkedContent: human individuals spurring on the devastation are subordinate to it, angry functionaries of their own mediocrity (Mittelmässigkeit), stand lower than wretched (Dürftige) who stand w/in their limits

content: abandonment of life as abandonment of Being, no longer allows for any beings > or, is a historical age where “life” in some form holds sway (herrscht), “the age of devastation”? [biopolitics?]

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

linkedContent: abandonment of life as abandonment of Being, no longer allows for any beings > or, is a historical age where “life” in some form holds sway (herrscht), “the age of devastation”? [biopolitics?]

content: desert is wasteland, deserted abandonment (Verlassenheit) of all life, nothing can emerge from itself [Greek physis] in this wasteland, & in this emergence (Aufgang) call others into a co-emerging (Mitaufgehen) > no perishing (Untergehen) in this desolation

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

content: historiological reckoning a consequence of devastation, man rolls into nothing > nihilism only historically actual when abandonment of beings by being occurs: this abandonment still lets beings be [?] > Nietzsche did not grasp essence of nihilism, remained caught (gefangen) in it, his metaphysics prepares for complete, unconditional nihilism, belongs to process of devastation
linkedContent: historiological reckoning a consequence of devastation, man rolls into nothing > nihilism only historically actual when abandonment of beings by being occurs: this abandonment still lets beings be [?] > Nietzsche did not grasp essence of nihilism, remained caught (gefangen) in it, his metaphysics prepares for complete, unconditional nihilism, belongs to process of devastation

content: malice of devastation reaches its extreme in appearance of secure state world, standard of living and its realization as highest goal [reaches its extreme in disguise]
linkedContent: malice of devastation reaches its extreme in appearance of secure state world, standard of living and its realization as highest goal [reaches its extreme in disguise]

content: under appearance of secured/improving life, a barring (Verwehrung) of life could occur: the being of all that is, ambiguous (zweideutig) to the core

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

linkedContent: under appearance of secured/improving life, a barring (Verwehrung) of life could occur: the being of all that is, ambiguous (zweideutig) to the core

content: doesn’t this thought that Being is malicious (bösartig) in the Ground of its essence (im Grunde seines Wesens) place an awful demand (arge Zumutung) on human thinking? > even more when one should not regard the idea that evil dwells in essence of Being as pessimistic > that thinking should be easy is a thought from spirit of devastation [spirit of revenge?]
linkedContent: doesn’t this thought that Being is malicious (bösartig) in the Ground of its essence (im Grunde seines Wesens) place an awful demand (arge Zumutung) on human thinking? > even more when one should not regard the idea that evil dwells in essence of Being as pessimistic > that thinking should be easy is a thought from spirit of devastation [spirit of revenge?]

content: young man wants to keep heart/mind free of the disturbing aura (Anhauch der Verstörung) of all ill-humored thinking [self-righteousness] > more essential the insight, the greater the tact it awakens in fellow men

motif.name: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP
motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

linkedContent: young man wants to keep heart/mind free of the disturbing aura (Anhauch der Verstörung) of all ill-humored thinking [self-righteousness] > more essential the insight, the greater the tact it awakens in fellow men

content: morally grounded world order will not ward off (gebannt) or end process of devastation > no matter the measures man takes, malice may remain Grundzug of Being
linkedContent: morally grounded world order will not ward off (gebannt) or end process of devastation > no matter the measures man takes, malice may remain Grundzug of Being

content: [can’t pass judgment on ontology of world-event] devastation comes forth from being, is a world-event (Weltereignis) that beleaguers (umlagert) the earth > person who passes judgment falls prey to quarreling/annoyance that gnaw at him, he becomes slave to self-righteousness (Selbstgerechtigkeit) [Nietzsche on revenge dimming one’s own eyes]
linkedContent: [can’t pass judgment on ontology of world-event] devastation comes forth from being, is a world-event (Weltereignis) that beleaguers (umlagert) the earth > person who passes judgment falls prey to quarreling/annoyance that gnaw at him, he becomes slave to self-righteousness (Selbstgerechtigkeit) [Nietzsche on revenge dimming one’s own eyes]

content: we won’t be tempted to get over the devastation, we’re guarding ourselves against getting over something (etwas fertig zu werden) > we’d rather learn to wait until (bis) our essence becomes free/noble, when it fits (fügen) aptly (schicklich) w/ the mystery of this destiny (dem Geheimnis dieses Geschickes) [arrival? total ambiguity btwn waiting for.. and becoming free], wait as though this Fügsame consists (bestehen) in waiting, as though waiting would have to outlast (überdauern) death

motif.name: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP
motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: the most difficult: to advise those affected by devastation w/out paternalism (Bevormundung), or haughtiness, prepare them for meditation required to become familiar w/ devastation as event that prevails outside human guilt (Schuld)/atonement (Sühne)

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

linkedContent: the most difficult: to advise those affected by devastation w/out paternalism (Bevormundung), or haughtiness, prepare them for meditation required to become familiar w/ devastation as event that prevails outside human guilt (Schuld)/atonement (Sühne)

content: death itself: something that waits in us > death waits upon our waiting > may we even ask what we wait for if we are properly waiting? [beyond Being] > when we wait upon something: Erwarten, in awaiting pure waiting is disturbed > pure waiting: wait upon nothing > but if we specifically wait upon Nothing, we are awaiting again > pure waiting: to wait on that which corresponds (entspricht) to pure waiting, better yet, that which answers (antwortet) pure waiting

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

linkedContent: death itself: something that waits in us > death waits upon our waiting > may we even ask what we wait for if we are properly waiting? [beyond Being] > when we wait upon something: Erwarten, in awaiting pure waiting is disturbed > pure waiting: wait upon nothing > but if we specifically wait upon Nothing, we are awaiting again > pure waiting: to wait on that which corresponds (entspricht) to pure waiting, better yet, that which answers (antwortet) pure waiting

content: we’d like to surmise (vermuten): waiting reaches a still-concealed dimension of time

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

linkedContent: we’d like to surmise (vermuten): waiting reaches a still-concealed dimension of time

content: this is all so simple & full of mystery, how could you know all this with such clarity since this morning? > in the simple experience (einfachen Erfahrung) of the coming, as that upon which we wait, what is healing draws near (naht), is granted (geworden) to us [so the experience is already the arrival?] > you say “to us” but it was only granted to you > I would like to share it now w/ you > my experience allows me to name for the you the wound beginning to heal, I was allowed/learned to presage (ahnen) [so priestly all this]
linkedContent: this is all so simple & full of mystery, how could you know all this with such clarity since this morning? > in the simple experience (einfachen Erfahrung) of the coming, as that upon which we wait, what is healing draws near (naht), is granted (geworden) to us [so the experience is already the arrival?] > you say “to us” but it was only granted to you > I would like to share it now w/ you > my experience allows me to name for the you the wound beginning to heal, I was allowed/learned to presage (ahnen) [so priestly all this]

content: is waiting a safeguarding (Hüten)/tending (Pflegen) if we are waiting upon nothing? > waiting is letting come (Kommenlassen) [in the sense of safeguarding, that which is entrusted (anvertraut) to us] [must the entrusted be present or can it still be held in reserve (noch aufbehalten)?] > what do we let come? > we let come the coming [Derrida, a-venir, to-come] > to think of the coming (an das Kommen denken): an enigmatic commemorating (Andenken) > waiting is future-directed and thus reversed commemorating > but if waiting does not await, neither directed toward future or past, nor something already present
linkedContent: is waiting a safeguarding (Hüten)/tending (Pflegen) if we are waiting upon nothing? > waiting is letting come (Kommenlassen) [in the sense of safeguarding, that which is entrusted (anvertraut) to us] [must the entrusted be present or can it still be held in reserve (noch aufbehalten)?] > what do we let come? > we let come the coming [Derrida, a-venir, to-come] > to think of the coming (an das Kommen denken): an enigmatic commemorating (Andenken) > waiting is future-directed and thus reversed commemorating > but if waiting does not await, neither directed toward future or past, nor something already present

content: the devastation (Verwüstung) already at work before destruction (Zerstörung) began
linkedContent: the devastation (Verwüstung) already at work before destruction (Zerstörung) began

content: withdrawal of human existence from ground of thinking, burning pain, we were not permitted to be there for the unnecessary, couldn’t be young [not there in ontic]
linkedContent: withdrawal of human existence from ground of thinking, burning pain, we were not permitted to be there for the unnecessary, couldn’t be young [not there in ontic]

content: the unnecessary is most necessary of all, only one who has learned this understands pain of human barred from thinking > thinking is thus the unnecessary, and yet thinking has a high rank of honor: the highest > I know this but don’t know the Grund of this > as if Occident couldn’t wait until thinking finds its originary essence: perhaps pure waiting, ability to wait [slow down, hastiness (Übereilung) of thinking thought as ratio, rationality]
linkedContent: the unnecessary is most necessary of all, only one who has learned this understands pain of human barred from thinking > thinking is thus the unnecessary, and yet thinking has a high rank of honor: the highest > I know this but don’t know the Grund of this > as if Occident couldn’t wait until thinking finds its originary essence: perhaps pure waiting, ability to wait [slow down, hastiness (Übereilung) of thinking thought as ratio, rationality]

content: [despite devastation], still genuine kind of youth among us > the older can protect genuine youth [?], wait properly, purify youth’s waiting, bring on path, ensure it’s not falsified w/ expectations [Erwartungen]
linkedContent: [despite devastation], still genuine kind of youth among us > the older can protect genuine youth [?], wait properly, purify youth’s waiting, bring on path, ensure it’s not falsified w/ expectations [Erwartungen]

content: hasty to think of man as thinker, mortal (Sterbliche) in distinction (im Unterschied) from immortal, thnētos, [finitude], a deeper definition of human than thinker? > poets more commonly refer to man as mortal
linkedContent: hasty to think of man as thinker, mortal (Sterbliche) in distinction (im Unterschied) from immortal, thnētos, [finitude], a deeper definition of human than thinker? > poets more commonly refer to man as mortal

content: can only think older definition man, mortal, by way of the younger, thinker, so that only common interpretation of zōon logon echon is shallow > we can think logos originally as gathering, human is thus in the gathering toward the originally all-unifying One (auf das urspünglich alles einigende Eine) > in this thought of logos thinking and mortality think the self same (im Grunde das Selbe) > older, like everything inceptual (Anfängliche), harder (schwerer) to think [finitude as thnētos]
linkedContent: can only think older definition man, mortal, by way of the younger, thinker, so that only common interpretation of zōon logon echon is shallow > we can think logos originally as gathering, human is thus in the gathering toward the originally all-unifying One (auf das urspünglich alles einigende Eine) > in this thought of logos thinking and mortality think the self same (im Grunde das Selbe) > older, like everything inceptual (Anfängliche), harder (schwerer) to think [finitude as thnētos]

content: in accustomed translation of mortality, it’s the relation to death, not to the immortals, that is named > only man, not animal, knows death, can go towards death > animal cannot die, cannot have death

motif.name: TRANSLATION / BABEL in TB (BENJAMIN'S "TASK OF THE TRANSLATOR")
motif.title: TRANSLATION / BABEL in TB (BENJAMIN'S "TASK OF THE TRANSLATOR")

linkedContent: in accustomed translation of mortality, it’s the relation to death, not to the immortals, that is named > only man, not animal, knows death, can go towards death > animal cannot die, cannot have death

content: only man can wait upon that which waits upon our entire being (Wesen) (like death) > as the being that can die, man is the being that waits > you have thought something beautiful
linkedContent: only man can wait upon that which waits upon our entire being (Wesen) (like death) > as the being that can die, man is the being that waits > you have thought something beautiful

content: your experience of healing now heals me, letting us become those who wait > the far is near in the nearness of what is held in reserve (Aufbehaltenen), the farness (Ferne) of what is dear (Holden) > for those who wait, the difference (Unterschied) btwn near/far opens most purely > those who wait will guard themselves from hastening to know that which heals in itself

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

content: [bringing 2 definitions of man together, thought & mortality, via attention & waiting] gathering toward the One of logos: something like attentiveness (Achtamsigkeit) prevails (waltet) > and isn’t attentiveness like the constant waiting on the pure coming > naturally this waiting essence remains unspoken [in both definitions]

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

linkedContent: [bringing 2 definitions of man together, thought & mortality, via attention & waiting] gathering toward the One of logos: something like attentiveness (Achtamsigkeit) prevails (waltet) > and isn’t attentiveness like the constant waiting on the pure coming > naturally this waiting essence remains unspoken [in both definitions]

content: those who wait learn right humble contentment (rechte Genügsamkeit), teachers of great poverty (Armut) > that which heals lets our essence wait: in waiting, human gathered in attentiveness to that which he belongs—can’t let himself get carried away (wegzuheben)/absorbed (aufzulösen) in it [danger of attention]
linkedContent: those who wait learn right humble contentment (rechte Genügsamkeit), teachers of great poverty (Armut) > that which heals lets our essence wait: in waiting, human gathered in attentiveness to that which he belongs—can’t let himself get carried away (wegzuheben)/absorbed (aufzulösen) in it [danger of attention]

content: waiting as though we pass unnoticed, unnamed [don’t know what we are], otherwise than all Erwarten, we’re not there for all who await/expect > in waiting, we’ve gone entirely away (ganz weggegangen), to our essence, required (gebraucht) by pure coming as inlet that answers it (als der Einlass, der ihm antwortet)

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

linkedContent: waiting as though we pass unnoticed, unnamed [don’t know what we are], otherwise than all Erwarten, we’re not there for all who await/expect > in waiting, we’ve gone entirely away (ganz weggegangen), to our essence, required (gebraucht) by pure coming as inlet that answers it (als der Einlass, der ihm antwortet)

content: we abandon (verlassen) ourselves in waiting, waiting is a footbridge (Steg): pure waiting like the echo of pure coming, we are the inlet (Einlass) for the coming [cf. 132] > in waiting we are purely “present” as literally “waiting-toward” [the German is simply: In Warten sind wir reine Gegenwart] [the hermeneutic circle]
linkedContent: we abandon (verlassen) ourselves in waiting, waiting is a footbridge (Steg): pure waiting like the echo of pure coming, we are the inlet (Einlass) for the coming [cf. 132] > in waiting we are purely “present” as literally “waiting-toward” [the German is simply: In Warten sind wir reine Gegenwart] [the hermeneutic circle]

content: the waiting is never boring because, in waiting on the coming, we already grant to each thing an inlet [arrival?]
linkedContent: the waiting is never boring because, in waiting on the coming, we already grant to each thing an inlet [arrival?]

content: we are used/needed ( as the string sounding the primordial play of the world, the most ancient provenance (Herkunft) > this instrument is aptly (shicklich) taken up/preserved (aufgehoben) im Veroborgenen > is not answer (Antwort), even in word (Wort), the selfsame as Gegenwart ——Gegenwart is related to time, Antwort related to word, so that time & word are more intimately kindred (verschwistert) than we have presaged (ahnen)

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

linkedContent: we are used/needed ( as the string sounding the primordial play of the world, the most ancient provenance (Herkunft) > this instrument is aptly (shicklich) taken up/preserved (aufgehoben) im Veroborgenen > is not answer (Antwort), even in word (Wort), the selfsame as Gegenwart ——Gegenwart is related to time, Antwort related to word, so that time & word are more intimately kindred (verschwistert) than we have presaged (ahnen)

content: in waiting we let things into where we ourselves belong, in rest (i.e. in return to themselves) > things, once returning as such, bring their own presence (Gegenwart) from themselves toward (entgegen) us, they fill out the emptiness that seems to gape around us as we wait > by not waiting on this restful repose, by hastening toward progress, humans become pacesetter (Schrittmacher) of devastation
linkedContent: in waiting we let things into where we ourselves belong, in rest (i.e. in return to themselves) > things, once returning as such, bring their own presence (Gegenwart) from themselves toward (entgegen) us, they fill out the emptiness that seems to gape around us as we wait > by not waiting on this restful repose, by hastening toward progress, humans become pacesetter (Schrittmacher) of devastation

content: pure coming on which we wait not blurry (Verfliessendes)/indeterminable (Unbestimmbares): the unique (Einzige) & simple (Einfache) itself
linkedContent: pure coming on which we wait not blurry (Verfliessendes)/indeterminable (Unbestimmbares): the unique (Einzige) & simple (Einfache) itself

content: freedom rests in being able to let, to let something be in that which it rests, so rare for man to let as such [so rare for man to be free] > this freedom alone true superiority (Überlegenheit), doesn’t need anything below it to remain above [Übermensch?]
linkedContent: freedom rests in being able to let, to let something be in that which it rests, so rare for man to let as such [so rare for man to be free] > this freedom alone true superiority (Überlegenheit), doesn’t need anything below it to remain above [Übermensch?]

content: freedom is not ruling or effecting
linkedContent: freedom is not ruling or effecting

content: if we were not already in essence those who wait, we could never become so [attention to Being] > we are only what we seek > seek only that on which we wait > wait on that in which we belong > we belong to the coming as the Gegenwart (present-waiting-toward) > as Gegenwart we release (lassen) ourselves to the coming, and in so releasing we 1st come into our own (eigen) > all these sentences say the selfsame > none can be preconceived, each thinks ahead (vordenkt) into the coming
linkedContent: if we were not already in essence those who wait, we could never become so [attention to Being] > we are only what we seek > seek only that on which we wait > wait on that in which we belong > we belong to the coming as the Gegenwart (present-waiting-toward) > as Gegenwart we release (lassen) ourselves to the coming, and in so releasing we 1st come into our own (eigen) > all these sentences say the selfsame > none can be preconceived, each thinks ahead (vordenkt) into the coming

content: the coming: that before (voraus) which nothing can be thought, the unprethinkable (das Unvordenkliche) [cf. Derrida to-come] > what heals can’t be set forth in propositional statements (in aussagenden Sätzen darstellen), but only conversationally surmised (gesprächsweise vermuten) [Derrida would say it can only be marked on the margins, nor would he call it what heals]

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: the coming: that before (voraus) which nothing can be thought, the unprethinkable (das Unvordenkliche) [cf. Derrida to-come] > what heals can’t be set forth in propositional statements (in aussagenden Sätzen darstellen), but only conversationally surmised (gesprächsweise vermuten) [Derrida would say it can only be marked on the margins, nor would he call it what heals]

content: those among a people (Volk) [Germans?] who poetize/think, wait in most noble manner: durch deren Gegenwart [through the present-waiting of the poet] zum Kommen das Wort in die Antwort des Menschenwesens gelangt und also in die Sprache gebracht wird > poets/thinkers wait on the arrival of this essence of theirs [devastation already passed over?], waiting people endangered like no other [rare], endangered not from outside threats but by tyranny of ignorant impatience, continual mistakes > Während dieses voreilige Scheinwesen [rash pseudo-essence] doch nur die ewig unbeholfene Nachahmung des Fremden bleibt [bad imitation of the foreign, Larry] > the people (Volk) who know its essence, can’t insist on it as a special calling (besondere Berufung)/distinction (Auszeichnung) > waiting people entirely unusable (unbrauchbar) to others, what waits yields nothing to be used (Nutzen) for progress > any fame of these people must be squander its essence purely on the unnecessary

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: those among a people (Volk) [Germans?] who poetize/think, wait in most noble manner: durch deren Gegenwart [through the present-waiting of the poet] zum Kommen das Wort in die Antwort des Menschenwesens gelangt und also in die Sprache gebracht wird > poets/thinkers wait on the arrival of this essence of theirs [devastation already passed over?], waiting people endangered like no other [rare], endangered not from outside threats but by tyranny of ignorant impatience, continual mistakes > Während dieses voreilige Scheinwesen [rash pseudo-essence] doch nur die ewig unbeholfene Nachahmung des Fremden bleibt [bad imitation of the foreign, Larry] > the people (Volk) who know its essence, can’t insist on it as a special calling (besondere Berufung)/distinction (Auszeichnung) > waiting people entirely unusable (unbrauchbar) to others, what waits yields nothing to be used (Nutzen) for progress > any fame of these people must be squander its essence purely on the unnecessary

content: [facetiously?] what’s more necessary than “getting down to businesses with the given facts (Zupacken im Gegebenen), remaking what is present at hand, and moving forward w/ what has existed before (Vorwärtsbringen des Bisherigen)”? > that factual sense of reality (Tatsachensinn) lets man stand squarely on ground, validates, secures, effectuates (wirken), holds fast—and yet can’t be w/out the unnecessary (Unnötige)
linkedContent: [facetiously?] what’s more necessary than “getting down to businesses with the given facts (Zupacken im Gegebenen), remaking what is present at hand, and moving forward w/ what has existed before (Vorwärtsbringen des Bisherigen)”? > that factual sense of reality (Tatsachensinn) lets man stand squarely on ground, validates, secures, effectuates (wirken), holds fast—and yet can’t be w/out the unnecessary (Unnötige)

content: waiting as authentic thinking? entering still-withheld essence of our [why our?] vanquished people > by becoming those who wait, we 1st become German? [become German, but not like Nazis… (cf. 154)] if we plan to find “the German” we simply chase after the national: nation as representation, so people become a subject, so that everything appears objective
linkedContent: waiting as authentic thinking? entering still-withheld essence of our [why our?] vanquished people > by becoming those who wait, we 1st become German? [become German, but not like Nazis… (cf. 154)] if we plan to find “the German” we simply chase after the national: nation as representation, so people become a subject, so that everything appears objective

content: nationality: pure subjectivity of a people, relies on its “Nature” as what’s actual (Wirkliche), and all effecting (Wirken) comes from and goes back to this “Nature” > in subjectivity, man asserts himself as ground/measure of what’s actual > thus emerges (entspringt) the uprising (Aufstand) into work as form of achievement through which devastation of earth becomes unconditional [in German one more sentence than in English: Das einzige Gesetz der Verwüstung ist, dass das Nötige das Nötigste und das allein Nötige sei] > business of devastation: work for sake of increased possibility of work [Marxish?]
linkedContent: nationality: pure subjectivity of a people, relies on its “Nature” as what’s actual (Wirkliche), and all effecting (Wirken) comes from and goes back to this “Nature” > in subjectivity, man asserts himself as ground/measure of what’s actual > thus emerges (entspringt) the uprising (Aufstand) into work as form of achievement through which devastation of earth becomes unconditional [in German one more sentence than in English: Das einzige Gesetz der Verwüstung ist, dass das Nötige das Nötigste und das allein Nötige sei] > business of devastation: work for sake of increased possibility of work [Marxish?]

content: national subjectivity remains in the international > international as mountain range, essential occurrence [das Wesende], of the national mountains
linkedContent: national subjectivity remains in the international > international as mountain range, essential occurrence [das Wesende], of the national mountains

content: what’s essential dwells most restfully in unspoken: those who wait have longest historical time (Geschichtszeit) before us

content: survival of devastation is not about a native kind (Geburtsart) [German nationalism] of human living on, but the pure duration of destiny (die reine Dauer des Geschickes) becom[ing] well-grounded (gut gegründet) by waiting on the coming [arrival?]
linkedContent: survival of devastation is not about a native kind (Geburtsart) [German nationalism] of human living on, but the pure duration of destiny (die reine Dauer des Geschickes) becom[ing] well-grounded (gut gegründet) by waiting on the coming [arrival?]

content: can do nothing more humble (Geringeres) than calmly letting ourselves engage in waiting (uns gelassen auf das Warten einzulassen)
linkedContent: can do nothing more humble (Geringeres) than calmly letting ourselves engage in waiting (uns gelassen auf das Warten einzulassen)

content: not the unnecessary that’s cast into abandonment but we who don’t pay attention to it are abandoned > must learn necessity of unnecessary, & teach it to the people > learning waitful when it is a seeking (Suchen), teaching waitful when advising (Raten)
linkedContent: not the unnecessary that’s cast into abandonment but we who don’t pay attention to it are abandoned > must learn necessity of unnecessary, & teach it to the people > learning waitful when it is a seeking (Suchen), teaching waitful when advising (Raten)

content: no matter their teaching, all “worldviews (Weltanschauungen)” belong to age of devastation
linkedContent: no matter their teaching, all “worldviews (Weltanschauungen)” belong to age of devastation

content: must attempt to tell friends what is given to them to think, but we ourselves must have “first constantly experienced and examined (erprüft) what is inexhaustibly (unerschöpflichen) given to the human to think”
linkedContent: must attempt to tell friends what is given to them to think, but we ourselves must have “first constantly experienced and examined (erprüft) what is inexhaustibly (unerschöpflichen) given to the human to think”

content: [Chinese philosophy] “human needs only enough space to be able to put his foot down” > but what use would be that standing if a crevice opened up to the underworld around it? [shortest shadow] > no more use > from this, necessity of unnecessary clearly apparent

content: something densely composed (Gedichtetes) is concealed in the poem (Gedicht) [condensation]
linkedContent: something densely composed (Gedichtetes) is concealed in the poem (Gedicht) [condensation]

content: a-nihilation (Ver-nichtung): In das Nichten des eigensten, verborgenen Wesens aufgehen lassen, d.h. in die Vergessenheit des Seins in der Gestalt der Anmassung seiner Einwirkung in der Vergegenständlichung [annihilation is absorption in nihilating of one’s essence, forgetting of Being]
